page.title: 18Deepcut Village
page.content: Our village has very few shops, but it has two churches, one Catholic and one Church of England. They are army churches so they have Chaplains instead of vicars. There is a tattooist in the village. Most of his customers are soldiers. Most of the trade with the takeaway food shops is also from soldiers. The village is busy with cars going up and down the main road. About 2000 people live in Deepcut village. Most of them are not in the army, but many have jobs with the army. My dad works for{Marconi,}an electronics firm in Frimley. Some residents are old age pensioners or retired army people. There is plenty of open space in the village which includes a park with swings, a roundabout and a climbing frame.
